bibl.title: A Bilingual Scribe's Complaint?
bibl.note: The Coptic text M.P.E.R., N.S. XVIII, 178 that is written in sixfold repetition at the bottom of the Greek text M.P.E.R., N.S. XV, 107 recto is not a letter, but the opening verse of Psalm 3 (1a).
bibl.seg: MacCOULL Leslie S.B., A Bilingual Scribe's Complaint?
The Coptic text M.P.E.R., N.S. XVIII, 178 that is written in sixfold repetition at the bottom of the Greek text M.P.E.R., N.S. XV, 107 recto is not a letter, but the opening verse of Psalm 3 (1a).
